Dagger PHP SDK

Namespaces

Dagger

  • Attribute
  • Dagger

Directory extends AbstractObject implements IdAble

A directory.

Table of Contents

Methods

asGit()  : GitRepository
Converts this directory to a local git repository
asModule()  : Module
Load the directory as a Dagger module source
asModuleSource()  : ModuleSource
Load the directory as a Dagger module source
changes()  : Changeset
Return the difference between this directory and another directory, typically an older snapshot.
chown()  : Directory
Change the owner of the directory contents recursively.
diff()  : Directory
Return the difference between this directory and an another directory. The difference is encoded as a directory.
digest()  : string
Return the directory's digest. The format of the digest is not guaranteed to be stable between releases of Dagger. It is guaranteed to be stable between invocations of the same Dagger engine.
directory()  : Directory
Retrieves a directory at the given path.
dockerBuild()  : Container
Use Dockerfile compatibility to build a container from this directory. Only use this function for Dockerfile compatibility. Otherwise use the native Container type directly, it is feature-complete and supports all Dockerfile features.
entries()  : array<string|int, mixed>
Returns a list of files and directories at the given path.
exists()  : bool
check if a file or directory exists
export()  : string
Writes the contents of the directory to a path on the host.
file()  : File
Retrieve a file at the given path.
filter()  : Directory
Return a snapshot with some paths included or excluded
findUp()  : string
Search up the directory tree for a file or directory, and return its path. If no match, return null
glob()  : array<string|int, mixed>
Returns a list of files and directories that matche the given pattern.
id()  : DirectoryId
A unique identifier for this Directory.
name()  : string
Returns the name of the directory.
search()  : array<string|int, mixed>
Searches for content matching the given regular expression or literal string.
sync()  : DirectoryId
Force evaluation in the engine.
terminal()  : Directory
Opens an interactive terminal in new container with this directory mounted inside.
withChanges()  : Directory
Return a directory with changes from another directory applied to it.
withDirectory()  : Directory
Return a snapshot with a directory added
withError()  : Directory
Raise an error.
withFile()  : Directory
Retrieves this directory plus the contents of the given file copied to the given path.
withFiles()  : Directory
Retrieves this directory plus the contents of the given files copied to the given path.
withNewDirectory()  : Directory
Retrieves this directory plus a new directory created at the given path.
withNewFile()  : Directory
Return a snapshot with a new file added
withoutDirectory()  : Directory
Return a snapshot with a subdirectory removed
withoutFile()  : Directory
Return a snapshot with a file removed
withoutFiles()  : Directory
Return a snapshot with files removed
withPatch()  : Directory
Retrieves this directory with the given Git-compatible patch applied.
withPatchFile()  : Directory
Retrieves this directory with the given Git-compatible patch file applied.
withSymlink()  : Directory
Return a snapshot with a symlink
withTimestamps()  : Directory
Retrieves this directory with all file/dir timestamps set to the given time.

changes()

Return the difference between this directory and another directory, typically an older snapshot.

public changes(DirectoryId|Directory $from) : Changeset

The difference is encoded as a changeset, which also tracks removed files, and can be applied to other directories.

Parameters
$from : DirectoryId|Directory
Return values
Changeset

chown()

Change the owner of the directory contents recursively.

public chown(string $path, string $owner) : Directory
Parameters
$path : string
$owner : string
Return values
Directory

diff()

Return the difference between this directory and an another directory. The difference is encoded as a directory.

public diff(DirectoryId|Directory $other) : Directory
Parameters
$other : DirectoryId|Directory
Return values
Directory

digest()

Return the directory's digest. The format of the digest is not guaranteed to be stable between releases of Dagger. It is guaranteed to be stable between invocations of the same Dagger engine.

public digest() : string
Return values
string

Retrieves a directory at the given path.

public directory(string $path) : Directory
Parameters
$path : string
Return values

dockerBuild()

Use Dockerfile compatibility to build a container from this directory. Only use this function for Dockerfile compatibility. Otherwise use the native Container type directly, it is feature-complete and supports all Dockerfile features.

public dockerBuild([string|null $dockerfile = 'Dockerfile' ][, Platform|null $platform = null ][, array<string|int, mixed>|null $buildArgs = null ][, string|null $target = '' ][, array<string|int, mixed>|null $secrets = null ][, bool|null $noInit = false ]) : Container
Parameters
$dockerfile : string|null = 'Dockerfile'
$platform : Platform|null = null
$buildArgs : array<string|int, mixed>|null = null
$target : string|null = ''
$secrets : array<string|int, mixed>|null = null
$noInit : bool|null = false
Return values
Container

Return values

$expectedType : ExistsType|null = null

search()

Searches for content matching the given regular expression or literal string.

public search(string $pattern[, array<string|int, mixed>|null $paths = null ][, array<string|int, mixed>|null $globs = null ][, bool|null $literal = false ][, bool|null $multiline = false ][, bool|null $dotall = false ][, bool|null $insensitive = false ][, bool|null $skipIgnored = false ][, bool|null $skipHidden = false ][, bool|null $filesOnly = false ][, int|null $limit = null ]) : array<string|int, mixed>

Uses Rust regex syntax; escape literal ., [, ], {, }, | with backslashes.

Parameters
$pattern : string
$paths : array<string|int, mixed>|null = null
$globs : array<string|int, mixed>|null = null
$literal : bool|null = false
$multiline : bool|null = false
$dotall : bool|null = false
$insensitive : bool|null = false
$skipIgnored : bool|null = false
$skipHidden : bool|null = false
$filesOnly : bool|null = false
$limit : int|null = null
Return values
array<string|int, mixed>

public sync() : DirectoryId
